metadata.Title: CVE-2017-8064 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
drivers/media/usb/dvb-usb-v2/dvb_usb_core.c in the Linux kernel 4.9.x and4.10.x before 4.10.12 interacts incorrectly with the CONFIG_VMAP_STACKoption, which allows local users to cause a denial of service (system crashor memory corruption) or possibly have unspecified other impact byleveraging use of more than one virtual page for a DMA scatterlist.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-8064` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.10.0-27-generic - 4.10.0-27.30~16.04.2
linux-image-4.10.0-27-generic-lpae - 4.10.0-27.30~16.04.2
linux-image-4.10.0-27-lowlatency - 4.10.0-27.30~16.04.2
linux-image-extra-4.10.0-27-generic - 4.10.0-27.30~16.04.2
No subscription required

linux-image-4.11.0-1009-azure - 4.11.0-1009.9
linux-image-extra-4.11.0-1009-azure - 4.11.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-4.10.0-1004-gcp - 4.10.0-1004.4
linux-image-extra-4.10.0-1004-gcp - 4.10.0-1004.4
No subscription required
